articles.title: Reply Message to Kim Jong Un from General Secretary of LPRP
articles.content:
Reply Message to Kim Jong Un from General Secretary of LPRP
Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, received a reply message from Bounnang Vorachith, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party (LPRP) and president of the Lao People's Democratic Republic, on Thursday.
					 The message said:
					
					 I express my heartfelt thanks to you on behalf of the Central Committee of the LPRP and on my own behalf for extending warm congratulations and wishes and sending a beautiful flower basket on the occasion of the 63rd anniversary of the founding of the LPRP.
					
					 I express my belief that the DPRK would as ever register bigger fresh achievements in defending a socialist powerful nation and accomplishing the cause of building it under the wise and resolute leadership of the WPK headed by you.
					
					 I wish you good health and success in your noble work.
					
					 I wish that the long-standing friendly and cooperative ties between the two parties, governments and peoples would grow stronger.

articles.title: New Stamps Issued
articles.content:
New Stamps Issued
Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK issued new stamps (sheetlet) showing eight famous scenes of the Sobaeksu Valley in the Paektusan Secret Camp where leader Kim Jong Il was born.
					 Printed on the stamps are pictures showing the most sublime Jong Il Peak, Snowscape of Kim Jong Il's native house and Sunrise Rock, Winged-horse Rock and Sword Rock, Terrain features appropriate to a natural fortress, Hoarfrost in the Sobaeksu Valley, Sobaek Stream flowing all seasons, Nocturnal view of fireworks display in February and Endless stream of visitors.
					
					 The eight famous scene of the Sobaeksu Valley, which were named in reflection of the unanimous will of all the army and people to always glorify the revolutionary history and feats of the peerlessly great man, are the precious treasure of Kim Il Sung's nation.

articles.title: U.S. "Human Rights" Racket against DPRK Is Absolutely Unjust: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. "Human Rights" Racket against DPRK Is Absolutely Unjust: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- An article of Rodong Sinmun Saturday dismisses the U.S. anti-DPRK "human rights" racket absolutely unwarranted.
					 The injustice of the U.S. "human rights" racket against the DPRK finds a manifestation in its abuse of the UN as a means for encroaching upon the sovereignty of independent states and for establishing the world domination order, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The UN is a stage for facilitating cooperation and exchanges among its member nations over human rights. It can never be a stage for justifying interference in the internal affairs of other countries and the racket for putting pressure on them.
					
					 But the U.S. is using the UN Human Rights Council entrusted with the mission and duty to contribute to guaranteeing human rights in the world as a means for interference in the internal affairs of those countries incurring its displeasure and subversion of their social systems.
					
					 Question is why the U.S. is getting keen on kicking up the groundless "human rights" racket.
					
					 By nature, the U.S. has left no means untried to stifle the DPRK out of its inveterate bitter repugnancy against the latter.
					
					 Its practice never works on the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK has faced the fate of bankruptcy. Just as a drowning man catching at a straw, the U.S. is resorting to the false "human rights" racket against the DPRK in the face of successive bitter defeats. Its aim is to internationalize "human rights" issue in the DPRK and kick off a worldwide campaign for putting the "maximum pressure" on the DPRK. In the end, it seeks to bring down the social system in the DPRK.
					
					 The situation makes one bear in mind the immutable truth that human rights precisely mean the state right and the sovereignty of the country and the nation, and that the military capabilities for self-defence have to be strengthened to defend them.

articles.title: Punishment of Those Who Tried to Quell Candlelight Demo Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Punishment of Those Who Tried to Quell Candlelight Demo Urged in S. Korea
Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- The Service Members Rights Center of south Korea released a statement on Mar. 21 in demand of the punishment of all who were involved in hatching a plot to suppress by force of arms the massive candlelight demonstrations waged across south Korea to oust traitor Park Geun Hye, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					 The statement noted that such fact was proved in a document.
					
					 It demanded investigation and punishment of all those involved in the plot to quell the candlelight demos by force of arms.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Jordan
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Jordan
Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- A Jordanian preparatory committee for celebrating the 106th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was formed on Mar. 15.
					 Marwan Sudah, chairman of the Arab Committee for Solidarity with Korean People and Supporting the Reunification of Korea, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee fixed a celebration period from Mar. 15 to April 15 and decided to conduct various activities of introducing the feats of the President and the invincible might of the DPRK in the period.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Germany
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Germany
Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was formed by the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany on March 16.
					 The chairman of the forum was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set a celebration period from March 16 to April 15 and decided to organize colorful political and cultural events in this period.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Romania
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Romania
Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- A Romanian national preparatory committee for marking the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the Day of the Sun, was formed on Mar. 15.
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council of the Nationalist Socialist Party of Romania and chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Romania, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee set a celebration period from Mar. 16 to April 15 and decided to hold political and cultural events in praise of the revolutionary career and feats of the President in the period.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Introduced in Brazil
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Introduced in Brazil
Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "Abuses of Socialism Are Intolerable" was posted on a website by the Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea on March 1.
					 The work, published on March 1, Juche 82 (1993), deals with the reactionary nature and falsity of the sophistry of the imperialists and the renegades of socialism calling socialism "totalitarian", "barracks-like" and "administrative and commanding".
					
					 It elucidates the principled issues arising in defending and accomplishing the socialist cause, including the issue of making the people have the unshakable faith in socialism and regard it as their moral duty to defend it and the issue of giving full play to the advantages of socialism.
					
					 The website carried the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Emitido sello sobre 8 paisajes del valle Sobaeksu
articles.content:
Emitido sello sobre 8 paisajes del valle Sobaeksu
Pyongyang, 24 de marzo (ACNC) -- La Direccion Estatal de Sellos de Corea emitio un papel enterizo que presenta 8 paisajes del valle Sobaeksu en el campamento secreto del monte Paektu donde hay la casa natal del Dirigente Kim Jong Il. 
					Esos panoramas son el pico Jong Il, la casa natal cubierta de nieve, los picos Haedoji, Ryongma y Janggom, la topografia apropiada a la fortaleza natural inaccesible, las flores de escarcha en el valle Sobaeksu, la corriente del riachuelo Sobaek en todas las estaciones, la vista de fuegos artificiales en febrero y las caravanas de recorrido. 
					
					Devienen valioso patrimonio de la nacion del Sol esos paisajes denominados asi segun el unanime deseo de los militares y habitantes coreanos de glorificar generacion tras generacion la historia y proezas revolucionarias del Dirigente.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun califica de injusto el alboroto de "DDHH" anti-RPDC
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun califica de injusto el alboroto de "DDHH" anti-RPDC
Pyongyang, 24 de marzo (ACNC) -- En un articulo individual de este sabado, el diario Rodong Sinmun revelo el caracter injusto del alboroto que arma EE.UU. contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en materia de derechos humanos.
					Ante todo, EE.UU. abusa de la ONU para violar la soberania de otro Estado soberano y establecer el orden de dominio mundial centrado en si mismo, precisa el articulista y continua: 
					
					La ONU no puede ser espacio para justificar la intervencion en asuntos internos y la campana de presion contra otros paises porque es el escenario de cooperacion e intercambio entre los paises miembros para asegurar los derechos humanos. 
					
					Sin embargo, el imperio americano utiliza el Consejo de DDHH de la ONU, cuya mision es contribuir al aseguramiento de los derechos humanos en escala mundial, como aparato para intervenir en asuntos internos de otros paises, que no le agradan, y derrocar sus regimenes. 
					
					Entonces, ?por que EE.UU. estaria tan desesperado para criticar a la RPDC en el tema de "DDHH"?
					
					Desde el principio, ese pais no reparo en medios ni metodos para aplastar a su rival socialista. 
					
					Al ver que esta condenada al fracaso su politica hostil a la RPDC, recurre ahora con mas apego a la absurda campana de "DDHH".
					
					Al internacionalizar el "problema de DDHH" de la RPDC y ejercer a esta la "maxima presion" pretextandolo e involucrando a todos los paises del mundo, quiere alcanzar su meta final de derrocar el regimen de ella. 
					
					La situacion ensena de nuevo la verdad de que los derechos humanos significan el poder estatal y la soberania nacional y para defenderlos, hace falta consolidar la capacidad de autodefensa nacional.
